00041         static UString numberToString(long i)
00042                 {
00043                 U_TRACE(0, "UStringExt::numberToString(%ld)", i)
00044 
00045                 UString x(32U);
00046 
00047                 x.snprintf("%ld", i);
00048 
00049                 U_RETURN_STRING(x);
00050                 }

00111         static void putenv(const char* name, uint32_t value)
00112                 {
00113                 U_TRACE(1, "UProcess::putenv(%S,%u)", name, value)
00114 
00115                 UString buffer(U_CAPACITY);
00116 
00117                 buffer.snprintf("%s=%u", name, value);
00118 
00119                 char* p = buffer.c_strdup();
00120 
00121                 (void) U_SYSCALL(putenv, "%S", p);
00122                 }
00123 
00124         static void putenv(const char* name, const char* value)
00125                 {
00126                 U_TRACE(1, "UProcess::putenv(%S,%S)", name, value)
00127 
00128                 UString buffer(U_CAPACITY);
00129 
00130                 buffer.snprintf("%s=%s", name, value);
00131 
00132                 char* p = buffer.c_strdup();
00133 
00134                 (void) U_SYSCALL(putenv, "%S", p);
00135                 }
00136 
00137         static void putenv(const char* name, const UString& value)
00138                 {
00139                 U_TRACE(1, "UProcess::putenv(%S,%.*S)", name, U_STRING_TO_TRACE(value))
00140 
00141                 UString buffer(U_CAPACITY);
00142 
00143                 buffer.snprintf("%s=%.*s", name, U_STRING_TO_TRACE(value));
00144 
00145                 char* p = buffer.c_strdup();
00146 
00147                 (void) U_SYSCALL(putenv, "%S", p);
00148                 }

00150         // manage escaping for delimiter character
00151         
00152         static UString removeEscape(const char* s, uint32_t n);
00153         static UString insertEscape(const char* s, uint32_t n, char delimiter = '"');
00154 
00155         static UString removeEscape(const UString& s)
00156                 {
00157                 U_TRACE(0, "UStringExt::removeEscape(%.*S)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(s))
00158 
00159                 uint32_t sz     = s.size();
00160                 const char* str = s.data();
00161                 void* ptr                = (void*) memchr(str, '\\', sz);
00162 
00163                 return (ptr ? removeEscape(str, sz) : s);
00164                 }
00165 
00166         static UString insertEscape(const UString& s, char delimiter = '"')
00167                 {
00168                 U_TRACE(0, "UStringExt::insertEscape(%.*S,%C)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(s), delimiter)
00169 
00170                 uint32_t sz     = s.size();
00171                 const char* str = s.data();
00172                 void* ptr                = (void*) memchr(str, delimiter, sz);
00173 
00174                 return (ptr ? insertEscape(str, sz, delimiter) : s);
00175                 }

00188         // Sort two version numbers, comparing equivalently seperated strings of digits numerically
00189         // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00190         // Returns a positive number if (a > b)
00191         // Returns a negative number if (a < b)
00192         // Returns zero              if (a == b)
00193         // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00194         static int compareversion(const char* a, uint32_t n1, const char* b, uint32_t n2);
00195 
00196         static int compareversion(const UString& s, const UString& a)
00197                 { return compareversion(U_STRING_TO_PARAM(s), U_STRING_TO_PARAM(a)); }
00198 
00199         static int compareversion(const UString& s, const char* a, uint32_t n)
00200                 { return compareversion(U_STRING_TO_PARAM(s), a, n); }

00202         /* Verifies that the passed string is actually an e-mail address */
00203 
00204         static bool isEmailAddress(const UString& s)
00205                 {
00206                 U_TRACE(0, "UStringExt::isEmailAddress(%.*S)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(s))
00207 
00208                 if (u_validate_email_address(U_STRING_TO_PARAM(s))) U_RETURN(true);
00209 
00210                 U_RETURN(false);
00211                 }

00213         // retrieve information on form elements as couple <name1>=<value1>&<name2>=<value2>&...
00214 
00215         static uint32_t getNameValueFromData(const UString& content, UVector<UString>& name_value, const char* delim = "&", uint32_t dlen = 1);
00216 
00217 #       define U_TOKEN_NM 4U
00218 #       define U_TOKEN_LN (U_TOKEN_NM + 8U)
00219 
00220         // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00221         // Very simple RPC-like layer
00222         //
00223         // Requests and responses are build of little packets each containing a U_TOKEN_NM-byte ascii token,
00224         // an 8-byte hex value or length, and optionally data corresponding to the length.
00225         // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00226 
00227         // built token name (U_TOKEN_NM characters) and value (32-bit int, as 8 hex characters)
00228 
00229         static void buildTokenInt(const char* token, uint32_t value, UString& buffer);
00230 
00231         static void buildTokenString(const char* token, const UString& value, UString& buffer)
00232                 {
00233                 U_TRACE(0, "UStringExt::buildTokenString(%S,%.*S,%.*S)", token, U_STRING_TO_TRACE(value), U_STRING_TO_TRACE(buffer))
00234 
00235                 buildTokenInt(token, value.size(), buffer);
00236 
00237                 buffer.append(value);
00238                 }
00239 
00240         static void buildTokenVector(const char* token, UVector<UString>& vec, UString& buffer)
00241                 {
00242                 U_TRACE(0, "UStringExt::buildTokenVector(%S,%p,%.*S)", token, &vec, U_STRING_TO_TRACE(buffer))
00243 
00244                 uint32_t argc = vec.size();
00245 
00246                 buildTokenInt(token, argc, buffer);
00247 
00248                 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < argc; ++i)
00249                         {
00250                         buildTokenString("ARGV", vec[i], buffer);
00251                         }
00252                 }
00253 };
